What was the main purpose of the Verus mainnet software update, and what features does it include?

The main purpose of this software update was to fix an overly aggressive block rejection in the VerusID protocol, and it is a mandatory update for the upgraded Verus mainnet. This release includes activation support for VerusID, and relative adjustments to the CPU and FPGA-equalizing VerusHash 2.1 Algorithm.

What happened to the Verus mainnet protocol at block 800200?
At block 800200, the Verus mainnet protocol was updated to include VerusID. This update is the latest update for the upgraded Verus mainnet.

What are VerusIDs, and how do they differ from other blockchain ID implementations?

VerusIDs are a fully functional blockchain protocol, not just an ID system. Unlike most blockchain ID implementations, there is no corporation involved in the protocol. VerusIDs provide plenty of opportunities for identity applications.
